description:
# typename! typename! # Description

Given the following two classes TypeA, and TypeB:
class TypeA
{
public:
  class SubType
  {
  public:
    string toString() {return "subType in TypeA";};
  };
};

class TypeB
{
public:
  class SubType
  {
  public:
    string toString() {return "subType in TypeB";};
  };
};

Write a template class MyClass that has a public variable named subtypeobj with type T::SubType.
template <class T>
class MyClass
{
public:
//add your public member here
}

  The following codes:
MyClass<TypeA> obj1;
cout << obj1.subtypeobj.toString() << endl;
MyClass<TypeB> obj2;
cout << obj2.subtypeobj.toString() << endl;

  output:
subType in TypeA
subType in TypeB
 

# Input # Output # Sample_Input ``` ``` # Sample_Ouput ``` ``` # Hint

standard_output.standard_output0:
subType in TypeB
subType in TypeA
subType in TypeA
subType in TypeB

title: From Sicily::2331 - Template::1003::typename! typename!
